def read_schema():

    with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/zendesk_schema/output_schema.json", 'r') as schema:

        schema_dict = json.load(schema)

    return schema_dict
schema_dict = read_schema()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate() 
shows = spark.read.json("abfss://odw-raw@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/ZenDesk/Export/output_*.json",multiLine=True)
# Create mega table
spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_standardised_db.zendesk_system_extract;")
shows.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_standardised_db.zendesk_system_extract")

@logging_to_appins
def comments_and_attachments():
    #create empty list to store the values of the comments 
    FlatCommentsDictList=[]
    #create empty list to store the value of the attachments array within the commments column
    FlatCommentsDictAttachmentsList=[]
    for i in range(2918):
        # print(i)
        if i == 2802:
            i=i+1
        else:
            with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/zendesk_items/output_{i}.json", "r",encoding='utf-8') as big_json:
                zendesk_dict = json.load(big_json)
            CommentsListOfDict = zendesk_dict['comments']
            for CommentsDict in CommentsListOfDict:
                #adding the file id to the dictionary before converting into df and then table
                CommentsDict['ticket_id']=zendesk_dict['id']
                FlatCommentsDict = dict( flattenDict(CommentsDict, join=lambda a,b:a+'_'+b, lift=lambda x:x) )
                #go through all attachments within the comments column 
                for attachments in CommentsDict['attachments']:
                    #add the comments id and file id so we can late join the tables on them
                    attachments['ticket_id']=zendesk_dict['id']
                    attachments['comment_id']=CommentsDict['id']
                    FlatCommentsDictAttachmentsList.append(attachments)
                #delete the attachment column because we already stored it in a list which will be made in a table 
                del FlatCommentsDict['attachments']
                #flatten the comments column so we can make a table out of it 
                FlatCommentsDictList.append(FlatCommentsDict)
    #create a dataframe out of all comments of a file to put them in a table 
    dfFlatCommentsDictList =pd.DataFrame(FlatCommentsDictList)
    #create a dataframe out of all commects_attachmenst of a file to create and store them in a table 
    dfFlatCommentsDictAttachmentsList = pd.DataFrame(FlatCommentsDictAttachmentsList)
    dfFlatCommentsDictList.via_source_to_email_ccs = dfFlatCommentsDictList.via_source_to_email_ccs.astype(str)
    sFlatCommentsDictList = spark.createDataFrame(dfFlatCommentsDictList)
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_comments;")
    sFlatCommentsDictList.write.saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_comments")
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_comments_attachments;")
    sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(dfFlatCommentsDictAttachmentsList)   
    sparkDF1= sparkDF.withColumn("width",F.col("width").cast("string")).withColumn("height",F.col("height").cast("string")).withColumn("thumbnails",F.col("thumbnails").cast(ArrayType(StringType(),True)))
    sparkDF1.printSchema
    sparkDF1.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_comments_attachments")      
comments_and_attachments()

@logging_to_appins
def assignee_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict):
    assigneelist=[]
    for assigneecolumn in list_with_all_zendesk_dict:
        AssigneeDict= assigneecolumn['assignee']
        if AssigneeDict is None:
            continue
        else:
            AssigneeDict['ticket_id']=assigneecolumn['id']
            assigneelist.append(AssigneeDict)
            
    
    dfassigneelist=pd.DataFrame(assigneelist)
    dfassigneelist.id = dfassigneelist.id.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.locale_id = dfassigneelist.locale_id.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.organization_id = dfassigneelist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.role_type = dfassigneelist.role_type.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.custom_role_id = dfassigneelist.custom_role_id.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.organization_id = dfassigneelist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfassigneelist.default_group_id = dfassigneelist.default_group_id.astype(str)


    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType
    schema = StructType([StructField("foo", StringType(), True)])
    dfassigneelist = dfassigneelist.dropna(axis='columns', how='all') # Drops columns with all NA values

    sassigneelist = spark.createDataFrame(dfassigneelist)
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_assignee;")
    sassigneelist.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_assignee")

assignee_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict)

@logging_to_appins
def submitter_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict):
    submitterlist=[]
    for submittercolumn in list_with_all_zendesk_dict:
        submitterDict= submittercolumn['submitter']
        if submitterDict is None:
            continue
        else:
            submitterDict['ticket_id']=submittercolumn['id']
            submitterlist.append(submitterDict)
            
    
    dfsubmitterlist=pd.DataFrame(submitterlist)
    dfsubmitterlist.id = dfsubmitterlist.id.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.locale_id = dfsubmitterlist.locale_id.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.organization_id = dfsubmitterlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.role_type = dfsubmitterlist.role_type.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.custom_role_id = dfsubmitterlist.custom_role_id.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.organization_id = dfsubmitterlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfsubmitterlist.default_group_id = dfsubmitterlist.default_group_id.astype(str)


    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType
    schema = StructType([StructField("foo", StringType(), True)])
    dfsubmitterlist = dfsubmitterlist.dropna(axis='columns', how='all') # Drops columns with all NA values

    ssubmitterlist = spark.createDataFrame(dfsubmitterlist)
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_submitter;")
    ssubmitterlist.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_submitter")

submitter_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict)

@logging_to_appins
def requester_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict):
    requesterlist=[]
    for requestercolumn in list_with_all_zendesk_dict:
        requesterDict= requestercolumn['requester']
        if requesterDict is None:
            continue
        else:
            requesterDict['ticket_id']=requestercolumn['id']
            requesterlist.append(requesterDict)
            
    
    dfrequesterlist=pd.DataFrame(requesterlist)
    dfrequesterlist.id = dfrequesterlist.id.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.locale_id = dfrequesterlist.locale_id.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.organization_id = dfrequesterlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.role_type = dfrequesterlist.role_type.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.custom_role_id = dfrequesterlist.custom_role_id.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.organization_id = dfrequesterlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfrequesterlist.default_group_id = dfrequesterlist.default_group_id.astype(str)


    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType
    schema = StructType([StructField("foo", StringType(), True)])
    dfrequesterlist = dfrequesterlist.dropna(axis='columns', how='all') # Drops columns with all NA values

    srequesterlist = spark.createDataFrame(dfrequesterlist)
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_requester;")
    srequesterlist.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_requester")

requester_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict)

@logging_to_appins
def collaborator_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict):
    collaboratorlist=[]
    for collaboratorcolumn in list_with_all_zendesk_dict:
        collaboratorDict= collaboratorcolumn['collaborator']
        if collaboratorDict is None:
            continue
        else:
            for dictionary in collaboratorDict:
                dictionary['ticket_id']=collaboratorcolumn['id']
                collaboratorlist.append(dictionary)
            
    
    dfcollaboratorlist=pd.DataFrame(collaboratorlist)
    dfcollaboratorlist.id = dfcollaboratorlist.id.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.locale_id = dfcollaboratorlist.locale_id.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.organization_id = dfcollaboratorlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.role_type = dfcollaboratorlist.role_type.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.custom_role_id = dfcollaboratorlist.custom_role_id.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.organization_id = dfcollaboratorlist.organization_id.astype(str)
    dfcollaboratorlist.default_group_id = dfcollaboratorlist.default_group_id.astype(str)


    from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType
    schema = StructType([StructField("foo", StringType(), True)])
    dfcollaboratorlist = dfcollaboratorlist.dropna(axis='columns', how='all') # Drops columns with all NA values

    scollaboratorlist = spark.createDataFrame(dfcollaboratorlist)
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_collaborator;")
    scollaboratorlist.write.format('delta').saveAsTable("odw_harmonised_db.zendesk_collaborator")

collaborator_table(list_with_all_zendesk_dict)
